EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of two stone furnaces at positions (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0) each paired with dedicated burner‑inserters and wooden chests that manage input and output for smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of a burner‑mining drill positioned at (–15.0, –50.0) linked to a nearby wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5) and integrated with a transport‐belt network that distributes extracted ore.

### Steam Power Generation System
Consists of:
• A boiler located at (8.0, 20.5)
• Multiple steam engines positioned at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5)
• An extra steam engine that remains unplaced due to severe congestion in the boiler zone and an obstructed buildable area near approximately (8.5, 22.5)

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of a lab entity configured for automation science pack research, currently facing power connectivity issues.

### Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
Consists of an integrated network of electrical poles, transport-belts (organized in BeltGroups), pipes (organized in PipeGroups), and associated connection groups that ensure coordinated flow of power, fluids, and materials across production areas.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to severe congestion around the boiler area (8.0, 20.5) and obstructed clearance in the nearby buildable zone (approximately 8.5, 22.5).
  – Mitigation: Perform a detailed manual inspection of the boiler region and connection interfaces to identify overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts. Remove, reposition, or adjust interfering entities, or alternatively, relocate the extra steam engine to a dedicated area with sufficient spacing or modify the boiler layout to enhance clearance.

• Burner Fuel Supply Issues
  – Multiple burner‑inserters and mining drills are reporting fuel shortages (NO_FUEL and WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS), which disrupt continuous operation.
  – Mitigation: Ensure that fuel sources are optimally positioned adjacent to burner entities to secure a steady supply of fuel.

• Steam Engine Connectivity Problems
  – Several steam engines generate warnings such as “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid” and “no fluid present in connections.”
  – Mitigation: Reexamine and adjust the electrical wiring and fluid pipe alignments for each steam engine to confirm that all connection points are clear and properly integrated with the power and fluid systems.

• Laboratory Power Deficiency
  – The Automation Research Lab remains without a stable power connection, hindering its research output.
  – Mitigation: Reevaluate the configuration and placement of nearby electrical poles and wiring to deliver a consistent and reliable power supply to the lab.
